title: Presenting Results in a Meeting
caption: A business presentation is underway in a modern conference room. Focus: clear description, cautious inference, and TOEFL practice.

image.alt: A man presents data on a screen in a meeting room while others sit at a table.

fullDescription.en: A business presentation is underway in a modern conference room. The presenter uses clear gestures to guide the audience through a chart, likely summarizing trends, results, or a strategy. Several colleagues sit around the table, watching and taking notes. The scene suggests decision-making, where evidence and numbers influence next steps.

grammar.title: Present Perfect (روندها تا الان)
grammar.rule: برای تغییرات از گذشته تا الان از **حال کامل** استفاده کن.

examples.en: Sales have increased over the last three months.
examples.fa: فروش در سه ماه گذشته افزایش یافته است.

grammar.title: Comparatives (مقایسه داده‌ها)
grammar.rule: برای مقایسه از **-er / more** و **than** استفاده کن.

examples.en: This quarter is stronger than the previous one.
examples.fa: این فصل قوی‌تر از فصل قبلی است.

examples.en: The new plan is more efficient than the old one.

descriptions.intermediate: A business presentation is underway in a modern conference room. The presenter uses clear gestures to guide the audience through a chart, likely summarizing trends, results, or a strategy. Several colleagues sit around the table, watching and taking notes. The scene suggests decision-making, where evidence and numbers influence next steps. The scene takes place in office conference room. Notable details include large screen; data chart. The overall atmosphere feels focused; serious. This lesson builds both everyday and academic language for describing the photo clearly, making inferences, and organizing ideas for TOEFL tasks.
descriptions.advanced: A business presentation is underway in a modern conference room. The presenter uses clear gestures to guide the audience through a chart, likely summarizing trends, results, or a strategy. Several colleagues sit around the table, watching and taking notes. The scene suggests decision-making, where evidence and numbers influence next steps. In this setting (office conference room), focus on precise visual evidence before adding careful inference about intent or context. You can highlight actions such as presenting results; pointing to a chart and explain how they shape the interaction or outcome. Use specific nouns and modifiers for details like large screen; data chart to improve clarity. Tone words (for example: focused; serious) help your response sound natural yet academic. You will practice academic vocabulary and structured responses for TOEFL speaking and writing tasks.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).
- Advanced: Adds inference language (probably/likely/might), contrast/linkers (while/whereas/in addition), and optional passive voice when relevant.
Add 1–2 inferences (why they are there, how they feel).
Use at least 2 collocations in your speaking/writing.

en.tense: Present Continuous (am/is/are + V‑ing) for actions happening now in the photo.
howToBuild: Choose the subject (who?): they / the family / the coworkers.

Add one short feeling sentence: They look… / The atmosphere feels…

There are large screen and data chart in office conference room.
The atmosphere feels focused.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself in office conference room. A presenter explains a chart on a large screen while colleagues listen. At first, I noticed large screen, data chart, conference table and the way people were presenting results. Then I looked closer: their clothing (business suit / blazer, business-casual audience) and their expressions made the scene feel focused, serious, engaged. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل office conference room بودم. A presenter explains a chart on a large screen while colleagues listen. اول large screen، data chart و conference table را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور presenting results. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (business suit / blazer و business-casual audience) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا focused، serious و engaged به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, the coworkers presented results.
Then, the coworkers checked large screen and continued.
Finally, they felt focused about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، The coworkers presented results.
بعد، The coworkers large screen را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه focused بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as large screen, data chart, conference table, laptops/notebooks are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like pointing to a chart can signal feelings such as focused, serious, engaged. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل large screen، data chart، conference table و laptops/notebooks فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل pointing to a chart چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل focused، serious و engaged را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: The coworkers have already handled similar situations before.
The coworkers have learned to stay focused in office conference room.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: The coworkers قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
The coworkers یاد گرفته است در office conference room focused بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment in office conference room, one small change could create a big problem. If large screen, data chart had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در office conference room دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر large screen و data chart نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If the coworkers had checked large screen earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay focused.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر The coworkers زودتر large screen را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید focused بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
